summary: The 2007-2009 financial crisis and the failures of large, complex financial institutions led some to question the adequacy of the Bankruptcy Code for reorganizing or liquidating these institutions. In response, the Dodd-Frank Act gave the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation authority for a regulatory alternative to bankruptcy. title: Financial Company Bankruptcies: Congress and Regulators Have Updated Resolution Planning Requirements
